definition: to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
to scratch/to thwart/to yield
variant of 腮[sai1]
cheek

sentences.english: It means to scratch your head in order to help you remember something you’ve forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你抓耳挠腮以使自己想起你遗忘的东西。

sentences.english: Actually he’s been sitting in front of his new Mac scratching his head for three YEARS now.
sentences.chinese: 事实上他已经坐在他崭新的电脑面前抓耳挠腮三年了。

definition: to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to search one's guts and belly (idiom); to racks one's brains for a solution
to look anxious (idiom)/to look miserable
to rack one's brains (for apt wording etc) (idiom)
lit. agitated sitting or standing (idiom)/restless/fidgety
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to fail to grasp the main points
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to worry helplessly
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
worried/anxious
